ygData.subject: RE: A Moral Delima
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t do anything you re not comfortable with.  There are lots of ways to avoid unwanted sexual situations in the game.  Relate to the person as a friend,
ygData.messageBody:
Don't do anything you're not comfortable with. There are lots of ways to
avoid unwanted sexual situations in the game. Relate to the person as a
friend, overtly, dismissing advances as a joke. Tell the person flat out
you're not interested. Make up some suitable background story, like your
spouse died, or was lost at sea, or something that allows you to dismiss
romantic possiblities without insulting the person. You could also just
say out of character that you're not comfortable with in-game romance, and
that you're just here to adventure and have fun.

- Christina

On Sun, 8 Aug 1999, Amber Gaines wrote:

> From: "Amber Gaines" <amber_sweet@...>
>
> Hey,
>
> Well, heres a little problem that follows the issue...
> I play a level 30 half-elf female, and from day one I've always had guys
> hitting on me, hehe.. Well in RL Im just a 20yr male w/ a fairly feminime
> personality and I love to dress and look like a girl when I have the
> oppurtunity.. Problem is Im totally straight so when guys hit on me I kinda
> like freak out and try to avoid them. Although one guy in particular never
> leaves me alone. He really is a nice guy. He groups with me alot and points
> some great hunting grounds out. Of course I never had the guts to tell him I
> really am a guy. He is around level 45 and knows alot of the high level
> people, and the last thing I want is to be constantly harrased by all of
> them when I start exploring the high level dungeons and need these people in
> my group.. Well, anywayz hes always trying to smooch me and such, and I just
> don't think I can be comfy roleplaying that.. maybe I should tell him I have
> a in game boyfriend already? Hmm, probably a little too late for that now..
> =\
>
> -Amber
